questions.question_text: The content table (sn_grcs_content) is a parent table of:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. sn_risk_definition
Explanation: Content[sn_grc_content] extending to following tables
 - Citation[sn_complance_citation]
 - Control object requirement[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
 - Risk Statment[sn_risk_definition]
 - Control object[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
Source; PDI, Content[sn_grc_content] Schema Map

questions.question_text: Which of the following roles can create a policy? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Answer:
 B. Compliance User
 C. Compliance Manager
Explanation: Quote "Role required: sn_compliance.admin or sn_compliance.manager"
Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/xanadu-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-policy-and-compliance/task/t_DefineAPolicy.html

Selected Answer: BC
Role required: sn_compliance.admin or sn_compliance.manager
Users with Compliance user (sn_compliance.user) role can also create policies.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-policy-and-compliance/task/t_DefineAPolicy.html
this is wrong, should be compliance manager & compliance user

questions.question_text: Which filter navigation syntax displays the default form view of the Risk table in the Content Frame?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer: A. sn_risk_risk.form
Explanation: i am sorry to have to say thsi, this question is kinda retarded... the <tablename>.form and <tablename>.do "syntax" display a form to create a new record in <tablename>, which is different to the literal meaning of default form view.... for those who are interested, navigation syntax:
 - <tablename>.list - display a list of All <tablename> records.
 - <tablename>.LIST - display a list of All <tablename> records in a new browser tab.
 - <tablename>.do - display a form to create a new record in <tablename>.
 - <tablename>.form - display a form to create a new record in <tablename>.
 - <tablename>.FORM - display a form to create a new record in <tablename> in a new browser tab.
 - <tablename>.config - display all of the application files for <tablename>.
 - <tablename>.CONFIG - display all of the application files for <tablename> in a new browser tab.
Source: PDI, navigation menu

Selected Answer: A
obviously it should be A
wrong, .FORM opens it in a new tab/window

questions.question_text: What three records need to be set-up when integrating with a provider RSS feed? (Choose three.)

comments.content: 90% of answers are wrong. Bad quality.

discussion.content: what is this? choose three, gives two answers, fix your tests - how is this worth the money?

the correct answer is ABD - Provider, Connection and Credentials, Feed Sources are inputs and regulatory feed record is the output... Reg change task is auto created if the feed is applicable. ebook pages - 191 and 192.

right ans - ADE 
E because from Feed setup you select regulatory change
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/xanadu-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-rcm/task/set-up-rss-feeds.html

Selected Answer: AB
Answer:
 A. Feed sources record
 B. Provider record
 D. Connection and Credentials record
Explanation: in the setup the RSS feed documentation (SN)
 step 4, Create New Connection & Credential under related links
 step 7, setup Feed Source Record and new previder record
Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/xanadu-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-rcm/task/set-up-rss-feeds.html

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-rcm/task/set-up-rss-feeds.html
